intro: Canthium annonifolium, commonly known as the African eggplant, is a tropical shrub native to Africa and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves that resemble those of the genus Annona. The plant produces small, green, egg-shaped fruits that turn red when mature, containing numerous seeds. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in disturbed soils or along riverbanks. The botanical features of Canthium annonifolium make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
